metadata.title: CVE-2023-52510 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ieee802154: ca8210: Fix a potential UAF in ca8210_probe Ifof_clk_add_provider() fails in ca8210_register_ext_clock(), it callsclk_unregister() to release priv->clk and returns an error. However, thecaller ca8210_probe() then calls ca8210_remove(), where priv->clk is freedagain in ca8210_unregister_ext_clock(). In this case, a use-after-free mayhappen in the second time we call clk_unregister(). Fix this by removingthe first clk_unregister(). Also, priv->clk could be an error code onfailure of clk_register_fixed_rate(). Use IS_ERR_OR_NULL to catch this casein ca8210_unregister_ext_clock().

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
